Sentencas: The first part of this two-part-paper develops a comprehensive nonlinear dynamic model of a solid-oxide fuel cell (SOFC) that can be used for dynamic and transient stability studies.
Titulo: Dynamic and transient analysis of power distribution systems with fuel cells - Part I: Fuel-cell dynamic model

Sentencas: The model based on electrochemical and thermal equations, accounts for temperature dynamics and output voltage losses.
Titulo: Dynamic and transient analysis of power distribution systems with fuel cells - Part I: Fuel-cell dynamic model

Sentencas: The output voltage response of a stand-alone fuel-cell plant to a step load change, a fuel flow step change, and fast load variations are simulated to illustrate the dynamic behavior of SOFC for fast and slow perturbations.
Titulo: Dynamic and transient analysis of power distribution systems with fuel cells - Part I: Fuel-cell dynamic model

Sentencas: A method for interfacing the proposed fuel-cell models to a power system stability package is developed.
Titulo: Dynamic and transient analysis of power distribution systems with fuel cells - Part I: Fuel-cell dynamic model
